com.thomsonreuters.platformservices.ema.utils.chain

Class FlatChain.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.platformservices.ema.utils.chain.FlatChain.Builder
  • Enclosing interface:
    FlatChain

    public static class FlatChain.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to build FlatChain objects. FlatChains are built as if they were immutable objects. This means that you can't directly change their fields once they are built (there is no setter). However, FlatChains cannot be considered as pure immutable objects as their state changes when they receive data from EMA.
    The following code snippet builds a FlatChain for the British FTSE 100 and set the two functions (lambda expressions in this case) to be called when the chain is complete and when an error occurs: 

        OmmConsumer ommConsumer = ...;
      .
      .
      .
    FlatChain theChain = new FlatChain.Builder()
                  .withOmmConsumer(ommConsumer)
                  .withChainName("0#.FTSE")
                  .onChainComplete(
                          (chain) -> 
                                  chain.getElements().forEach(
                                          (position, name) -> 
                                                  System.out.println("\t" + chain.getName() + "[" + position + "] = " + name)
                                  )
                  )
                  .onChainError(
                          (errorMessage, chain) -> 
                                  System.out.println("\tError received for <" + chain.getName() + ">: " + errorMessage)
                  )
                  .build();

    Note: The name of the chain and the OmmConsumer are the two mandatory parameters that must be set for every FlatChain (see withChainName(String) and withOmmConsumer(OmmConsumer)).

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public FlatChain build()
        Builds the FlatChain
        Returns:
        the built FlatChain

      • withOmmConsumer

        public FlatChain.Builder withOmmConsumer(com.thomsonreuters.ema.access.OmmConsumer ommConsumer)
        Sets the EMA OmmConsumer used by the chain to subscribe to the underlying Chain Records. This OmmConsumer must have been properly initialized and connected to a Thomson Reuters real-time infrastructure.
        Parameters:
        ommConsumer - the OmmConsumer that will be used by the chain to subscribe to the underlying Chain Records.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • withChainName

        public FlatChain.Builder withChainName(java.lang.String chainName)
        Sets the name of the chain.
        Parameters:
        chainName - the name of the chain.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • withServiceName

        public FlatChain.Builder withServiceName(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Sets the name of the service the chain is published on. This service name is used by the chain to subscribe to the underlying Chain Record. If the service name is not set the default "ELEKTRON_DD" service name will be used.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - the name of the service the chain is published on.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • withUpdates

        public FlatChain.Builder withUpdates(boolean withUpdates)
        Indicates you are interested in chain updates or not. If you set withUpdates to true the chain will be kept updated with the messages received from the EMA OmmConsumer. You will also be notified of changes via the FlatChain.ElementAddedFunction, FlatChain.ElementChangedFunction or FlatChain.ElementRemovedFunction functions if you set them at build time. These calls may happen before and after the chain is complete.
        If withUpdates is not called, the default value (false) will be used.
        Parameters:
        withUpdates - whether or not you're interested in chain changes.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • withSummaryLinksToSkip

        public FlatChain.Builder withSummaryLinksToSkip(SummaryLinksToSkipByDisplayTemplate summaryLinksToSkipByDisplayTemplate)
        Sets the number of summary links to skip when opening the chain. Some chains start with summary links (elements) that you may want to skip because they are not part of the chain's constituents. The number of summary links to skip depends on the Display Template used by the chain. This method allows you to set the number of summary link to skip for several display templates. Checkout this Thomson Reuters article to learn more about chains and summary links. If this method is not called, no summary links will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        summaryLinksToSkipByDisplayTemplate - the number of summary links to skip per display template.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • withNameGuessingOptimization

        public FlatChain.Builder withNameGuessingOptimization(int guessesCount)
        Activates the "Name Guessing Optimization" and sets the number of names to guess when the chain subscribes to a new Chain Record. Checkout this Thomson Reuters article to learn more about the name guessing optimization. If this method is not called, the "Name Guessing Optimization" is not activated.
        Parameters:
        guessesCount - the number of names to guess. A reasonable value would be between 5 and 50.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • onElementAdded

        public FlatChain.Builder onElementAdded(FlatChain.ElementAddedFunction function)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • onChainComplete

        public FlatChain.Builder onChainComplete(FlatChain.ChainCompleteFunction function)
        Sets the function to be called when the chain is complete. Usage example with a lambda expression: 

            FlatChain theChain = new FlatChain.Builder()
                  .onChainComplete(
                          (chain) -> 
                                  chain.getElements().forEach(
                                          (position, name) -> 
                                                  System.out.println("\t" + chain.getName() + "[" + position + "] = " + name)
                                  )
                  )
                        .
                        .
                        .

        Parameters:
        function - function to be called when the chain is complete.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.

      • onChainError

        public FlatChain.Builder onChainError(FlatChain.ChainErrorFunction function)
        Sets the function to be called when an error occurs.
        Usage example with a lambda expression: 

            FlatChain theChain = new FlatChain.Builder()
                  .onChainError(
                          (errorMessage, chain) -> 
                                  System.out.println("\tError received for <" + chain.getName() + ">: " + errorMessage)
                  )
                        .
                        .
                        .

        Parameters:
        function - function to be called on errors.
        Returns:
        this Builder so that you can chain other Builder methods calls.
